<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_getattr:
```c
lfs_ssize_t lfs_getattr(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_getattr(%p, \"%s\", %"PRIu8", %p, %"PRIu32")",
            (void*)lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    lfs_ssize_t res = lfs_getattr_(lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_getattr -> %"PRId32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_getattr:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static lfs_ssize_t lfs_getattr_(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    lfs_mdir_t cwd;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }

    uint16_t id = lfs_tag_id(tag);
    if (id == 0x3ff) {
        // special case for root
        id = 0;
        int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &cwd, lfs->root);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    tag = lfs_dir_get(lfs, &cwd, LFS_MKTAG(0x7ff, 0x3ff, 0),
            LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_USERATTR + type,
                id, lfs_min(size, lfs->attr_max)),
            buffer);
    if (tag < 0) {
        if (tag == LFS_ERR_NOENT) {
            return LFS_ERR_NOATTR;
        }

        return tag;
    }

    return lfs_tag_size(tag);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The code passes &path (the address of the function parameter 'path') to lfs_dir_find: lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL). If lfs_dir_find updates the pointer (e.g. advances *pathp), this modifies the parameter variable 'path' itself rather than the object it points to, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. A safe fix is to pass the address of a local copy (const char *p = path; &p) instead.
